their search results. I'm just curious whether it's possible, even if you have consumers' best interests at heart, that you might actually be doing harm to the broader field of tech innovation? If Google as a search engine loses sight of what users really want, I'm sure there will be enough companies out there willing to fulfill that need. That's why competition is such a good thing. It keeps everyone honest, and clearly it keeps every company involved focused on the users. I believe a competitive landscape, an open market, allows Google and other companies to do the right things for their users, because it's in their best interests when users are happy with the product. While Dermot O'Leary would href="http://www.earthtimes.org/tag/love.html"> love to continue working with Simon Cowell by taking a role on the US' X Factor' he is trying not to worry about it. He said: I'm keeping my head out of it. I want to do it but I'm being philosophical about it. If I get it that's fantastic and if I don't, I don't.

Guantanamo Bay one of world's finest prisons: Donald Rumsfeld THE`` war on terror'' prison at the US naval base in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba is one of the finest prison systems in the world, former defence secretary Donald Rumsfeld has said. Donald Rumsfeld , who is promoting his autobiography Known and Unknown, praised US military personnel who worked at the site in the interview on Fox News Channel's Hannity show.

by Mike Pence , R-Ind., that would deny federal family-planning funds to any organization that performs abortions. Mike Pence makes clear that Planned Parenthood is his target; it would lose more than$ 70 million in annual funding. Every American should be shocked that an employee of the largest recipient of federal funds under Title X has been recorded aiding and abetting underage sex trafficking, Mike Pence said.`` The time to deny any and all funding to Planned Parenthood is now.''
